meanings.definition: To make (water, a liquid, etc.) muddy.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the kids enjoyed muddying the puddles in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The construction work was muddying the once clear stream.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy couldn't resist muddying the clean kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were muddying the pages of her diary, blurring the words.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes expertly captured the act of muddying the canvas with earthy tones.

meanings.definition: To make (something) less clear or transparent.
meanings.sent1: The fog was muddying the view of the distant mountains.
meanings.sent2: His conflicting statements were muddying the truth of the matter.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved muddying the audience's understanding of reality.
meanings.sent4: The gossip was muddying the reputation of the small town's mayor.
meanings.sent5: The old window was muddying the sunlight, casting a dim glow into the room.
